articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Any management team has only so much bandwidth.  You see the effect of this in organisations when the pressure is applied.  Urgent matters, the ones that come screaming into your inbox, or literally banging on your door, tend to take your focus. Strategically important issues seldom do this.  They can sit in the outfield for [...]
articles.title: Constricted club management bandwidth

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC target Dara O’Shea has seen his value more than DOUBLE in just over a year. The Republic of Ireland international centre-back joined Burnley in a £7million deal from West Brom in June 2023. Now, despite the Turf Moor club’s relegation from the English top flight last season, the defender is valued at £15million – and that [...]
articles.title: £15m O’SHEA? NO WAY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU rated goalkeeper Tobi Oluwayemi so highly he brought the former Spurs prospect into Celtic squads preparing for Champions League games. The 21-year-old prospect will spend this season on loan at third-tier Dunfermline after a deal was struck between the clubs yesterday. The former England Under-20 international netminder is relaunching his career at East [...]

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: I know we’ve touched on this before, but I continue to see, “Why do Celtic always leave it until the last minute?’ question asked about the transfer window.  This is not a difficult question, in fact, it is the easiest question you will ever get about how football works. Why do Brighton always leave it [...]
articles.title: Transfers: supply and demand

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MIKEY JOHNSTON is on the brink of ending his seven-year Celtic association. The Republic of Ireland international winger is poised to sign a permanent deal for Championship side Burnley. Johnston, 25, is reportedly due for a medical at the Turf Moor club ahead of agreeing a five-year contract. The wide man impressed during his short-term [...]
articles.title: JOHNSTON ON THE BRINK

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: FORGOTTEN Celtic defender Yuki Kobayashi has left the champions in a four-year deal to Portuguese side Portimonense. The Japanese centre-back didn’t make a solitary appearance for Brendan Rodgers’ men last season and has now quit Parkhead for an undisclosed fee, according to the Scottish Sun. Kobayashi was signed by ex-boss Ange Postecoglou on a free [...]
articles.title: SAYONARA, YUKI

articles.description: THE Kyogo Furuhashi link to Manchester City has come out of the blue – quite literally. The tale is akin to the pebble rolling down the mountain that creates [...]
articles.title: THE KYOGO CONUNDRUM

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The omens on Matt O’Riley remaining in Glasgow beyond the end of the month are not encouraging.  Celtic knew Brighton were in the market and could be encouraged to pay more when they rejected repeated high bids from Atalanta.  If a player is moving on, a competitive auction is useful. We are in the business [...]
articles.title: We should always be ready to trade

articles.description: CELTIC are stepping up their urgent bid for a new left-back as cover for Greg Taylor. Brendan Rodgers has no experienced deputy for the Scotland international and Liverpool No.3 Owen Beck is on the Hoops manager’s radar for a second time. The Welsh Under-21 defender caught the gaffer’s eye during his impressive loan stint at [...]
articles.title: BECK IN THE FRAME

articles.description: FORMER Celtic boss Neil Lennon has been sacked after just THREE months in charge of Rapid Bucharest. articles.title: LENNY’S RAPID EXIT

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS is in a beat-the-clock race to bring in midfield reinforcements with Matt O’Riley on the brink of sealing his £25million-plus move to Brighton. The Celtic boss has already brought back Paulo Bernardo in a £3.5million deal from Benfica after the Portuguese playmaker’s impressive season on loan. However, Rodgers knows he still needs to [...]

articles.description: FROZEN-OUT Celt Gustaf Lagerbielke is a wanted man as the transfer deadline approaches. Lagerbielke knocked back the chance of a return to his homeland with Malmo offering a [...]

articles.description: KASPER SCHMEICHEL has revealed he dismissed interest from English top-flight teams to accept the demands of playing for Celtic. Schmeichel left Belgian outfit Anderlecht at the end of the season as a free agent [...]
articles.title: REVEALED: ‘I LOVE THE DEMAND,’ SCHMEICHEL

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: August is a perilous time for predictions.  Teams are still working on fitness, new arrivals are often learning the language, and until the window closes, players can still come and go, affecting the performance of anyone competing for the title. That’s easy for us to say, though.  Across the city, all they can see is [...]

However, Lawal will be forced to wait for his debut after an issue was flagged up during his medical. Jon [...]

articles.description: CELTIC have a 100 per cent record after their first three games of the new campaign. Some fans are already talking in [...]

articles.description: LEIGH GRIFFITHS celebrates his 34th birthday today in Australia. This time three years ago, the one-time prolific hitman was still a Celtic player. However, following an unsuccessful loan stint at Dundee and a brief spell at third-tier Falkirk during the wretched 2020/21 campaign, he is now player/coach at Mandurah City. The somersault in the former Scotland [...]

The South American superpower were prepared to lavish a landslide of Argentine pesos on the Parkhead club’s gifted midfielder, the possessor of sublime talents. The Boca scouts had become more than a tad excited by the [...]

articles.description: THERE was never the hint Celtic would stage a repeat of last season’s banana skin when they toppled out of the League Cup at the first hurdle against Kilmarnock at Rugby Park.
